sense.name: loose affiliation of gangsters, the mob
sense.commentary: SYNDICATE[+entity][+affiliation][-legal][+gangster] Note: refers to illegal affiliations and activities
sense.examples: He was the boss of a big crime syndicate in Chicago. They are racketeers who work for a local syndicate. They believe he's still running his syndicate from behind bars.

sense.name: legal companies affiliated for some purpose, cartels
sense.examples: It was a buyout involving a syndicate of financial institutions. His firm recently joined a manufacturing syndicate.

sense.name: news agency that sells news to multiple publishers
sense.examples: They are one of the major news syndicates in the United States. She is the sole heiress to her father's huge publishing syndicate.
